reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you get this game dirt cheap as a part of a Bundle Stars package (or similar), then I recommend it, otherwise avoid.

The good
It has trading cards
It was part of a cheap bundle so it cost me practically nothing

The bad
Interesting idea derailed by poor translations and a clumsy QTE system
It feels amateurish and cheap with half scanned photographs, half cel-shaded cartoon art
Like another reviewer commented, the romance you have with Marina seems rushed and implausible.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI feel like this one has potential as a VN-type game.  I was ok with the translation errors, enjoyed the background pictures and the story (as far as I went...)   The QTE bits were kind of annoying to be honest.  I do appreciate trying to add some interaction, but this didn't work for me.   Ultimately, I got bored before I finished. (I played a couple hours, the rest was idling for the final card drop).    I'd give it a side-ways thumb if I could, but ultimately I wouldn't recommend it to anyone I know.

Early Access Review\n\nEnjoyed it. Has some rough patches with transltions and unnecessary QTEs. The story is decent though, and it made me curious about what wouod happen next. I hope they downplay the hallucination aspects, as they seem like a cop out. Maybe they are trying to borrow too much from the Metro storyline. There is also one multiple choice quiz late in the game that seems to have you brute force guessing 5 questions in a row.
Early Access Review\n\n5 minutes in there's a quick time event with instructions in Russian.  I can't read Russian, so I couldn't figure out what to do.  Game over.
